question: A free-floating astronaut ‘A’ pushes another free-floating astronaut ‘B’ in space. The mass of ‘A’ is greater than that of ‘B’. The force exerted by the astronaut ‘A’ on the astronaut ‘B’ will be?
option2: Equal to the force exerted by ‘B’ on ‘A’
option3: Greater than the force exerted by ‘B’ on ‘A’.
option4: Less than the force exerted by ‘B’ on ‘A’
explanation:
An astronaut is floating around in the space and gives another person a push. Newton\'s third law says that if he pushes the other person, it will push back on him with an equal and opposite force.
So the force exterted will be zero.
